definition: to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things
section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)

sentences.english: Our terms of payment are cash on delivery.
sentences.chinese: 我們的付款條件是貨到付款。

sentences.english: The things ordered by mail are usually paid on delivery.
sentences.chinese: 通常郵購商品都是貨到付款的。

sentences.english: We insist on payment in advance, we can’t accept payment after arrival goods.
sentences.chinese: 我們堅持預付貨款，不能接受貨到付款。

sentences.english: People who buy things from the internet usually prefer COD (cash on delivery).
sentences.chinese: 在網上購物的人通常會選擇貨到付款。

sentences.english: Did he send the package C. O. D. ?
sentences.chinese: 你用“貨到付款”的方式寄包裹嗎？
我一般情況下貨到付款。

sentences.english: Would it be possible for you to send the goods to me C. O. D. ?
sentences.chinese: 能否麻煩將貨物以貨到付款方式寄給我？

sentences.english: Suggest choosing manners of cash on delivery and intra-city transactions.
sentences.chinese: 建議選擇貨到付款和同城交易的方式。

sentences.english: Our payment term is C. O. D—cash on delivery.
sentences.chinese: 我們的付款方式是貨到付款。

sentences.english: People who buy things from the internet usually prefer COD.
sentences.chinese: 在網上購物的人通常會選擇貨到付款。

sentences.english: I think I want to have it COD, I can wait.
sentences.chinese: 我想我還是貨到付款好了，我可以多等等。
請郵送這隻大衣箱，貨到付款。

sentences.english: Our rule is cash-on-deliver, when receive pay the balance at once.
sentences.chinese: 我們規定貨到付款，收到貨請立即付清餘款。

sentences.english: Our payment term is C. O. D―cash on delivery.
sentences.chinese: 我們的付款方式是貨到付款。

sentences.english: Please send us the following items C. O. D.
sentences.chinese: 請按貨到付款條件發運下列商品。

definition: to replace a purchase/to exchange a purchase
online banking/abbr. for 網上銀行|网上银行[wang3 shang4 yin2 hang2]
to return a product for another item
to bargain/to cut or beat down a price
